section.name: Learning Maven
section.span: References to good Maven pages (TODO) and some handy notes.

ol.li: Maven commands always works on the current directory, so you have to cd to the directory you want Maven to work on.
Maven commands will only work on directories containing a pom.xml file, which defines a maven project.
A project may contain subprojects, of which the root directory contains its own pom.xml.

If you have no time for the tests or the tests themselves are broken, the tests can be skipped with -DskipTests: mvn -DskipTests clean install Although the older flag -Dmaven.test.skip still works, the documentation of the maven plugin explicitely advices NOT to use it, as maven.test.skip will change the build procedure. Different artifacts are the result.
